title: Please just add a save function that works.
comment: So someone replied from OnyxBits saying that whenever you restore you always start with a clean slate. This confused me. What if you are deep in a game of Zork and you have to do something so you leave for an hour or two and when you wanna play again, you need to start over. What's the fun in that? It's annoying having to start over and over again. I really just wanna save and have it actually SAVE what has happened and my progress in the game.
The save games files only record the state of the game, not the screen output. Therefore you always start with a clean slate after restoring a game.

title: Save file is not compatible with other Z-machine interpreters
comment: Also I cannot load saves created by other interpreters. Are there any good methods to convert save files for the purpose of resuming a game in a different interpreter? Thanks!
TextFiction interprets storeis written in Z-Code. The authoring tool of choice for this format is called "Inform" (http://inform7.com)

title: HELP PLEASE!!!!
comment: Ok this looks extremely fun...but it won't work when I try to download them. It'll say sorry your browser has stopped...and I really REALLY wanna play this game...please someone help. By the way I have an android a samsung galaxy s3.

title: FINALLY
comment: I cannot describe the joy I felt in finding this. I am in love with making and playing text based adventure games, and boy is this amazing. This is not for people who want a regular rpg game, but for those who like to read and use their imagination to solve puzzles and things, A MUST GET! I mean, there is no excuse if its free. Give me a good reason NOT to get it

title: Great, but some issues
comment: I've tried several different If interpreters, but this is the only one that I always come back to. Update: I've recently discovered that about 80% of my games (I have more than 50) read as: Corrupt game file, and do not work at all. If this can be fixed, I'd give 5 stars in a heartbeat!
Those are likely z4 games and sadly that format is not supported.
Works well, no real complaints.

title: Great for newbies too!
comment: I'm relatively new to the world of IF, and this app has been a great introduction. It directs new users to some beginner (tutorial) stories, and makes it easy to find games that interest you. The only things I'd like to see changed are listing the score and day/time (in game) on the main screen while playing (as this is important in some games), and correcting the issue of double enters with just one "enter" press when using a bluetooth keyboard. I found a temporary fix for the latter issue by selecting the "auto collapse keyboard" option under settings, but this makes it so I have to manually select the text entry field every time before typing - annoying, but better than the program interpreting one press of the enter button as two. Still, a great program with lots of potential. Thanks!

title: Very good, however...
comment: I downloaded a game from the site (if that helps, it was .z3 and appeared a .txt in my downloads) and it doesn't appear on the import list. Other than that, it's okay.

title: Text Adventure Joy
comment: Brilliant app for nostalgic text adventurers like me whose first computer was an Atari ST

title: Was good for 1 day
comment: It was perfect for a day, now it won't load games. Stuck on loading screen. Help :(

title: Buono.
comment: It's fantastic.!

title: Nifty
comment: Fast enough and seems to work well, well done!

title: Love It
comment: I wish I can play IF with format other than Zblorb, Z8, Z5, etc

title: Great!
comment: A very good version. Tested so far with Zork and Hitchhiker's Guide. Interface is nice to use, even on a small screen due to the "click existing words".   Two comments: save before changing focus! Sometimes your progress will be lost... Also, using the back button to remove keyboard to read the game text; if you double click you'll be back at the z file selection and will loose progress.   Saving and restoring works via the menu.
Does what it does really well

title: Great App!
comment: I have loved all the games I have played so far. The variety is great. Really brings me back.
Press plus sign on the right to bring up the menu.

title: Hours to days of entertainment
comment: I love this.

title: Hjkg
comment: Byr

title: The best!
comment: I really love this app. Now I can read IF to my heart's content on my phone ♡

title: Best app for playing IF
comment: Smooth ui, better than other text based game apps
Excellent app

title: Library directory options please
comment: Really nice app. Only thing keeping it from a higher rating is that I cannot designate the path for the game library. My device has very limited storage space and it would be extremely nice if I could store my game files on my external micro SD card instead of having store everything in the internal storage of the device. Edit: gave an extra star cause I got a new device. Still think adding games is a bit fidly and would still like library path options.
Game files are only a few hundred kilobytes in size max. Nevertheless, the library is kept on the external storage (thats why the app requests the permission to write there!)

title: HELP ME!
comment: Sometimes i cant open the catalog , saying web not found , etc . When i can , i can just download the tutorial and 9:05 !! I tried to download anything else with ALL BROWSERS I HAD and its saying web not found ,etc and its frustating.. I even do a research and found ifdb . When i download elephant tower ( idk is it elephant tower ) its error again ! I just cant download z-machine ( i know zmachine because of that research ) at all !!!! Help meee!!!

That sounds like a problem with the webbrowser on your device (maybe a misconfigured proxy, no internet connection or being cut off by your ISP due to exceeding your bandwidth quota). In any case, that is nothing I can help you with.

title: Great
comment: Please add someting to game for creating our own story and share it
Games can be created by using the Inform7 authoring tool (http://inform7.com)

title: Update?
comment: Will there be an update?
There will be updates when people motivate me with pizza and coffee to work on this project :).

title: Great Z-Language Interpretor
comment: Please incorporate the ability to play z4 games!!!  All the best vintage Infocom were formatted in z4 (Bureaucracy,  A Mind Forever Voyaging,  Nord & Bert).

title: A perfect app
comment: It's a simple genre, but the app is well thought out and easy to use. great choice of games too.

title: No Zork!
comment: I can't download any of the zork series, which was the main reason I got this :(
The links in the catalog seem to work fine.

title: awesome!
comment: And the app is smart :)

title: Definitely the best interpreter
comment: I tried similar apps, this one wins smoothly.

title: I love these things but...
comment: You guys need more stories and understand more commands. I tried all kinds of commands but it was just "fill it". Fill what with what? And they tell me to be specific... My Dreamhold isn't working. Whenever I type "go east" it forces me to close. Also, how do you go back to your game after looking at the hints? I pressed all the buttons and none of them led me back.

title: LOVE IT TO BITS
comment: It has rekindled my dream of creating video games... well, "games". Not much Video about it, but that's part of the charm, really.

title: A+
comment: This is a diamond in the rough seas of IF interpreters. Highly recommended!

title: Refers to a Menu ...
comment: ... Maybe it requires the old offscreen menu button?
Either the hardware menu button or the "+" symbol on the left should open the menu.

title: Great App
comment: Best text adventure app by far. If you like old skool adventuring install this.

title: Excellent app
comment: Works great and I love the shortcuts. The only thing I'd change is adding the option to display the score in the main screen.

title: Spontaneously Reads at Max volume
comment: Feature is maddening and cannot be disabled. App restores volume to max volume apparently at random. I have been thoroughly startled about once per half hour of use. For the sake of my cardiac health, I have uninsulated this app. Please make 'disable screen reader' an option.
This option is available in the settings.

title: Great app
comment: I have downloaded several different readers to play some old-school text adventure games and gave up on most of them quickly because of glitches. So far, not a single problem exploring the Underground Empire!

title: External Keyboard Issues
comment: Head and shoulders above the other options on android, just wish I didn't get a double enter whenever I was using a BT keyboard.

title: Great Fun!!
comment: Shortcut keys are a plus. I like the look and feel of the text message format. Works great!!

title: Love it...BUT...
comment: ...I can't figure out how to save games. It keeps saying you can only do that from the menu, but all I find is help and settings. Any help?
The menu is opened from the PLUS symbol left of the commandline.

title: Wonderful
comment: Can't say anything severe other than it feels like the site with the downloadable files could have more. I also had an issue with a couple not loading other than that, you can't beat text adventures.

title: Minor problem
comment: After I open any of the stories, it keeps loading and it loads slow. What can I do?

That may be a bug with the progressbar not getting hidden under certain circumstances. Once the game accepts input it is fully loaded and operational. It my be nescessary to restart the app to get rid of the spinner.

title: Yay!
comment: Lots if fun. Great twists and unexpected a settings.

title: Excellent z interpreter
comment: Makes playing parser text adventures more fun.  The intuitive UI saves a lot of typing to create fluid game play.  The accompanying website is clear making it easy to choose interactive fictions. Highly recommended.

title: Outstanding
comment: Now someone needs to make an app that allows you to create stories to play for this app.
The authoring system of choice is called "Inform" -> http://inform7.com

title: Great app.
comment: Nice and clean. Easy to use.

title: Very good IF interpreter
comment: Works well and conveniently

title: I beg your pardon
comment: Works good, but if using my Logitec keyboard every time I type something I get the action wanted and a message "I beg Your Pardon" This is annoying after a bit. This app has not been updated in a year it looks like.

title: GREAT!
comment: Precisely what I was looking for! Now I can play the whole Zork collection.

title: EXCELLENT Z Interpreter!
comment: This is the BEST interactve-text shell program I've run across that is for Android. It is fast, responsive, intuitive and makes interactive fiction that much more fun because of one-key entries and icon selection actions. You don't even have to use the keyboard for most of your action commands. It is a very well thought out format and game-play method and allows you to just focus on the game. Excellent app that I would recommend to anyone.

title: Great!
comment: Good interface, much nicer than having to type everything in.

title: The best
comment: I just hope it can play graphical versions too and a gblorb.. Coz i love this app that i dont want to use another app

title: Great!
comment: I had thought twisty was the best on android, but I didn't try this yet. This is the best! Works marvellously for hhgg.

title: Amazing!
comment: As a huge fan of text-based games, this really is like hitting the jackpot! Wide game selection, easy to use and SO much fun, plus most games have a large amount of replay value! Only wish I could save my games, but that's not a huge issue for me. All in all, this was a very well-made app that is totally worth getting!

title: Amazing
comment: The best interactive fiction reader out there. Can't wait for more extension support!

title: Really great z interpreter!!!
comment: Easily the cleanest and most responsive I've seen, the smart interface takes a little of the tedium out of the command line only interface. Love it!!  I only have one issue: When I use my wireless Logitech 920 keyboard over bluetooth, for some reason every time I hit enter, it issues 2 enter commands. As a result, the engine first interprets my command, and then an empty green bubble appears, to which the interpreter responds, "I beg your pardon?" If that little fix could be made, it would be wonderful!  Great product!!

title: Very good interpreter. This is the way it is done
comment: My only gripe is that it chokes on some games. Most will at least run from IF archive though

title: Best so far for Android
comment: Fast and intuitive UI has now replaced JFrotz on my phone. Layout is obviously designed to appeal to younger generation although I use fullscreen 'Jason' theme to save screen space. Download of new stories is easier than other interpreters too. No support for coloured text though e.g. in Photopia. Otherwise great.

title: Fantastic
comment: Would love to see glulxe supported.

title: Best I've found so far
comment: Definitely the best Android z-machine interpreter I've found. The only possible drawback is that the "text message" look might inhibit some games that played with formatting (I.e. ascii art, status bar stuff, etc) but I honestly haven't even encountered this as a problem yet -- just something to consider for the future perhaps. And it'd be worth it just to have such a smooth interpreter 99% of the time. The rest are all buggy or the keyboard gets in the way so much you can't even read.

title: Great app
comment: It's really great emulator for Text based games. It works smoothly and the interface is simple.

title: One of the best I have found
comment: I love the old school text adventures and have pretty much everything Infocom ever released.  This is definitely the best interpreter I have found for the tablet.

title: Easy to use
comment: Does what it's supposed to! :-)

title: Really well presented text adventure app
comment: I was looking to play a text adventure and came across this little gem! Great web support and simple interface. Merits 5 stars because not only does it do what it should do, but it does it nicely!

title: Great!
comment: A very simple to use app. But is there a way to implement glulx into it? (In reply to your comment, it would be better than not having any glulx supported apps in the store)
I would love to, but that's not a trivial thing to do. It would take a few months fulltime to adapt Glulx to the needs of Android.

title: Worth downloading
comment: Really good interface and some good layout options have been added. Look forward to the day when Glulxe is added.

title: As good as it can get
comment: Difficult as it is to play IF on a phone, I can't imagine a much better phone app for this.
Needs glux support.
Great!  Needs Glulx and TADS support, through.

title: Brilliant
comment: Amazing implementation of a z-machine interpreter. I was pretty skeptical until I actually used the app, but the intuitive input system works amazingly well.
The great UI makes it possible to play without a physical keyboard. The only thing it lacks is Glulxe/gblorb support.

title: Well..
comment: This game looks pretty awesome one thing is, i cant even download the stories... i allreay download it.. still not in the text fiction.. i press the restore button thing from the folder, but its says there are no story.. plz help.
Well designed, but it would be desirable for it to read gblorb files.

title: Awesome layout
comment: I've seen only a few for pc, but this one has a amazing layout. Having more fun than ever with it. My only problem is that I didn't find too much games on website, maybe it's because the type is old and almost nobody create these types of games. Can I download games from other websites? What is the game format for this one?
Cant get storys ether
Please note that reviews are NOT a support forum. And "doesn't work" is also NOT an adequate description of the problem if you expect any help with getting it to work.

title: Won't let me download stories
comment: Was excited about using this app however it won't let me download stories as it say they aren't supported :(
Works well with zork!

title: Cool Programme
comment: Playing text fiction on the go is great! A nigh endless supply of stories. And you can save whenever you like. Perfect
Awesome

title: Very nice
comment: Unfortunately without the ability to designate a library path this app is useless to me. Add that and this will be the best Z interpreter on Android.
This is supported, please see the manual for details.

title: Zork or most anything else
comment: This app is the best way to do text adventure on a smart phone. It is feature rich and looks great. The customizable display is more useful than you might think. Only improvement possible is more support for other game file types besides .z files.
Absolutely the best Interactive Fiction app out there.

title: It works !!
comment: Thank you for recent update.

title: Good, but...
comment: Loses three stars for the lack of a save function and the fact that it won't open all appropriate files even if they're in your downloads folder. Edit: Okay, so why should I have to pull out of the game in order to save? What's wrong with simply allowing me to type 'save' and having that work?
The save function is available from the menu.

title: Best Z machine yet, library directory would improve
comment: I've tried a lot of z interpreters, and this is my favorite because: * It's well laid out, and text is easy to read (not miniscule unicode) * Useful shortcut buttons (examine, take, open, etc) * Ability to click on a word in the story and include that in your command  The only thing that could make it better would be a user-defined library location, rather than the "download" folder only.  It's a lovely interface, though, thank you for the app.
Your library is (typically) kept on the SD-Card. The Download folder only serves as a pass-through. You can delete the story file from there once you have started playing the game.

title: Great App.
comment: Runs without any hiccups.

title: OMG
comment: Thanks so much for this.  Frotz seems to have been abandoned.  Very excited to play all my Infocom games.

title: Great except if using an external keyboard
comment: It's easy enough to import games as long as you move them to your download folder and that is stated very clearly, however if you use an external keyboard pressing enter submits the line and an extra blank line.  I'd happily go to give 5 stars if fixed.  Thanks for a quality app!  :)

title: Great mobile implementation
comment: Even though it's unavoidably finnicky on a smartphone (tablet would no doubt be better) this app does well in addressing the mobile shortcomings for IF (keyboard and screen). Nice job!  Suggestions: - I miss a way to quickly retry a previously typed command line. Most interpreters have up / down buttons you can press repeatedly to cycle through previous inputs. - Some kind of rudimentary (auto)mapping of visited locations or anything alike (see Trizbort). I can't play most IF properly without creating maps.

Repeating the exact same command is rarely useful and editing a commandline is cumbersome. Better to rebuilt it from the right bubble. If you need a comman often, bind it to a button (long press).

Mapping: The z-machine does not expose gamestate. A fully manual mapper would not live up to expectations.
won't let me import games or select. Directory. Fix and ill be back

title: How IF should be on a mobile device
comment: Finally someone gets it. The input is similar to some interpreters I had on my Palm devices way back when. Just needs to handle Glulx to get 5 stars!

title: Issues
comment: I appreciate that there is still development, but currently it has issues lining up text, drawing the status bar at the top of the screen, and will not even load Bureaucracy. Perhaps the future will be better.

title: If done almost perfect
comment: Easy to use IF machine. The only problem is the IF getting process. This problem is one that the big stores like steam or play store, the if you like this then you might like these problem. Extra Credit has a episode on it.

title: Can't save
comment: I love the game so far, however I can't save. Every time I try to save it says "save failed." I have a Samsung galaxy 4 phone with Verizon. Is there something I'm missing?
You have to use the menu. It doesn't work on the commandline.

title: I would gladly pay for this
comment: The best app to play interactive fiction I have ever tried. It made me want to play IF again after some time.... Kudos to the developers.
Awesome app
Cracking app.

title: Its ok
comment: I think you mite want to add a save file so I dont have restart it every time.
You can save/restore your game from the menu (via command won't work for technical reasons).

title: Brilliant
comment: Just what I was looking for!

I really like text fiction games and so more the reason I had to check out this app. Playing the text adventures on my tablet is fun and the interface is well done. However I can't figure out how to save my progress on any game and while the developer addressed the problem I'm still clueless. I'm hoping the instructional video will help clear things up but for now I'm going to have to rate this app 3 stars.
You can only save/restore games from the menu. It won't work through commands. If that's not the problem, please email me about the issue. Reviews are not suitable for doing support.

title: I'm not sure why, but
comment: for some reason, I'm not able to import anything, I just get a message saying that there was nothing found in the downloads folder but I'm not actually able to point it in the right direction.
Perhabs you used a webbrowser for downloading that did not obbey standard file paths. In this case you have to use a filemanager to move the .z3 (.z5 or .z8) file manually to your Download folder.

title: Good emulator
comment: Appealing visually and a very good emulator of.z files

title: USERS BEWARE
comment: THE WEBSIYE IS FULL OF VIRUSES!!
False Alarm. Also: "Email developer" would have been the sensible way to report this issue.

title: Jason theme fc's the app
comment: Fix it and put jason inverted theme thanks!
Whoops! Jason was missing some layout information for small screens. Just uploaded a bugfix version (v2.4). Should be available in a couple of minutes.
I like the copy and paste feature, but the balloon wrapper is not to my liking.

title: Awesome app!!!
comment: Just need an option to disable the text box style setup. But is minor, works wonders. Cannot find an app as good as this one for my Mac for text adventures.
Great app, but it won't let me save my games... basically eliminates enjoyment.
You have to save from the menu. Saving via commands is NOT implemented.

title: Hands down the best IF app for android.
comment: Absolute perfection

title: Nearly perfect.
comment: You guys should link this to the IF Archive. Just sayin'.
Story 1

title: Best one out there
comment: Except I wish it would save the history on your stories when you reload them. That way you could look back and know what you did and where you are.

title: Nice IF player
comment: Sometimes crashes on "corrupt file" when I press a key instead of the check button.

title: Perfect
comment: I absolutely adore this app, but please make more themes with a dark grey backgrounds rather than just completely black.
great interface

title: Awesome IF app!
comment: Works great, highly configurable,  -almost- everything I'd hope for! I would pay for a GLULX version outright, or at the very least donate a highly feature-enhanced cup of fancy coffee!

title: Confusing
comment: The format isn't user friendly.
Please send me an email, outlining how you'd expect the UI to work.

title: Finally.
comment: After enjoying Frotz on the iPad I was really disappointed with JFrotz on Android. This app though is way better; it simply works. There are just a few features missing, like copying text to the clipboard for taking notes; also, it'd be nice if it would show existing file while saving for simple overwriting if existing savegames. I'd be willing to throw in some Dollar if these humble requests need some motivation :-)

I'm currently working on v3.0 which  will have massive under the hood changes. I'll try to put these things in, but it will take a while (yes, a couple of dollars will motivate me :D). Please send me an email if you have specific ideas/suggestions about the note taking (NOTE: marking text in the bubbles is not possible for technical reasons).

title: Incredible
comment: Oh my God! This is amazing! All the other Interactive Fiction apps are so lame! But this is beautiful.

title: Plughed this to a 5
comment: I love this app to bits. Almost gave up on it when i couldn't save through command, but luckily i stumbled upon a helpful review and have played joyously ever since.The scrolling sys is (hella) smooth. The themes are okay. The font is agreeable, though optional font styles (comic sans, anyone?) would be great (perhaps some optional changes to the txt boxes?). The quick buttons are brilliant (saves a lot of time !) Am ecstatic for next update. You guys are magic

title: I like it but...
comment: Whenever I try to save, it just says save failed so when I'm really far in my adventure I and I have to quit, I have to start all over! The autosave does not work at all, which is pretty frustrating considering how fun and helpful this app is, and could be.
Don't use the save/restore commands. They are not implemented (the matter is unfortunately rather complicated). If you want to save/restore, you have to do it via the menu.

title: The very best for interactive fiction
comment: Wonderful app. Beautiful, you can tap words on the screen and not type them, makes it much easier to play. And it does not annoy you with ads! Can't beat that. Highly recommended.

title: Great fun! Thank you very much!
It is cool
comment: Awesome

title: Really cool app, but..
comment: Why can't I choose the path of my game file? I mean it's kind of stressing to move it to /TextFiction folder.   5 stars although.

a) TextFiction uses a lot of auxiliary files (e.g. savegames, button settings) and the game file is a key for referencing.
b) Most users don't want to bother with the Filesystem.
c) From your FileManager, you can choose "open with" and TF should automatically import the game.

title: Great
comment: Great

title: Excellent
comment: You've made my favorite kind of game even easier and more fun to play!
By far the best if engine I've tried on android.

title: Would like full screen mode
comment: One more star for full screen and. Another if you add dialog to restart for new theme
Fullscreen mode: added ; Restart dialog: added  - Pay up :D.

title: Great!
comment: An awesome app for those who loves the '80s and '90s. I remembered reading Goosebumps :3 still, it consumed a lot of battery

title: I love these kinda games but...
comment: Everytime I pusthe back button on my phone it takes me back and I have to start all over, or save, constantly. Fix that and maybe add a music. Option you'll get your five stars

TextFiction should automatically save your progress in slot "AUTOSAVE" whenever you quit the current game (there is no autorestore for usability reasons). Music: that clashes with TTS on one hand and on the other, your system music player probably does a better job here (there simply is no one-size-fits all tune for all the games TF can play.

title: Love it!
comment: Would like to see improved handling of non-A-Z characters like åäöÅÄÖ (sending more information through mail). Thanks to the developer for being very active in responding to reviews.

zblorb is supported. As for adding swedish support: I need sample games for that. The #2976 is probably intented as a workaround for games doing things they are probably not suppose to do. It's best to contact me via email about these matters.

title: Best if interpreter
comment: Seriously. I have tried many, but this one... Best!

title: Great!
comment: Brilliant. Been having good fun with the easy to use UI!  One thing that would be nice, would be if autocorrect could be added as it seems to not function - meaning I get a lot more noun errors than I normally would ;-)
Not quite sure what you mean. Text Fiction uses the standard keyboard, so you should not get more spelling errors than in other apps.

title: Excellent
comment: Better than most other games. Surely worth the download!

title: Love it!
comment: Much more user friendly than other Z-machine interpreters. I wish it supported Glulx or TADS, though.  Edit: Thanks dev! Glulx support will be great! Some of my favorite IF is not in Z-code.
Glulx is on the "planned features" list. No ETA though. Better navigational support (on screeen compass) will come first.

title: Awesomness
comment: You sir/mam or bringing back nerd koolness..lol

title: Been waiting for this
comment: Been waiting for this...looks like I got to the party late and most issues have been fixed.  :-D
saves are working
Saving/Restoring works. You have to do it through the menu, though. The "save" and "restore" command is detached for now (it will likely become RAMsave/quicksave feature in the future).

title: Great
comment: Great

title: Awesome!!!
comment: Awesome app! Especially for someone who loves books like me, this is a very welcome change from most of the games I play. Keep up the good work!

title: awesome
comment: great game!

title: Finally
comment: Thank you guys so much for making this! Finally something truly worthwhile to keep me entertained on the go.

title: Great app, reserving 5th star for night mode
comment: EDIT: Dev added night mode - debt paid. Perfect app now that I don't have to become blind to use it at night :P.
Done - pay up :P

title: Very cool
comment: This app is a wonderful recall to the days of old

title: Finally an auto save
comment: Keep it up. Very unique.

title: Great idea
comment: Very immersing game

title: Won't start
comment: I really want to play the game, but it won't start. I deleted some of my other games to play it and it keeps force closing. Please fix, it looks like a lot of fun.
Did not provide any additional info for three weeks. Bugs that can't be reproduced can't be fixed either. Likely cause in this case: a privacy app revoking permission to access the SD card.

title: Yay
comment: I've been searching for a game like this and Finally Yay

title: Does exactly what it says.
comment: There is a lack of games on the play store with a depth in the story rather than having flashy graphics and tons of integrated social features. Text adventures is perfect for this, and this app does it in a great way for an android device. Looking forward too se how it evolves!

title: Great game, loved Arnold Schwarzenegger in this
comment: Don't know why was represented as Luigi, I'd have preferred him as Mario. I love plumbing stuff.

title: Tons of fun
comment: I've never played IF games before, but I'm so glad this app has introduced me to them! As a beginner, it was easy to get started and learn the basics right away. And now I'm loving it!

title: Fantastic
comment: Interface is spectacular, and I have waited SO LONG to do IF on my phone...
Entertaining, interesting and fun!

title: Reddit
comment: Have an upvote!

title: Fun as can be!
comment: I love it so far.
